section.p: To allow the attribute to appear in the GUI, so that you can configure it into a rule, add the attribute to the PCRF custom rule attribute dictionary under the CDR result context, along with its appropriate Triggers. This means that you must modify the PCRFCustomRuleAttributeDictionary.xml file, as required, for attribute name, value type, result context, and applicable triggers.
The following is an example of the lines you would use to modify the PCRFCustomRuleAttributeDictionary.xml file to add the attribute name CC-Request-Number.

fig.codeblock: <attributeDictionary xmlns="ruleAttributeDictionary"> <attribute name="CC-Request-Number" valueType="IntegerValueType"> <resultContext type="CDR" maxOccurs="1"> <ruleSet>IPCAN_SESSION_ESTABLISHMENT</ruleSet> <ruleSet>IPCAN_SESSION_MODIFICATION</ruleSet> <ruleSet>IPCAN_SESSION_TERMINATION</ruleSet> </resultContext> <domain name="NETWORK"/> </attribute>

section.p: To enable logging of the custom attribute, you can write a rule that has an action to add the value given in the rule for the custom attribute. For example:
To complete the operation, you must restart the ASR server and reload the dictionary using the reload-dictionary command.
